review: At first I use baddo for many years then a problem arose where they became discriminatory against me. Without knowing the actual facts they banned me instead of asking me my input. They didn’t even care! All they cared about was banning me from baddo. Lack of respect for there users. Lack of consideration! What a shame. As a 59 year old man I don’t have any time for this nonsense. Baddo! To quick to judge! Have some respect for others before you discriminate. Baddo never investigates they alway go by what people say. Baddo should be reported to the FCC for discrimination towards there users
title: Unfair and disrespectful

developerResponse: {'id': 15538399, 'body': "We're sorry to hear this. We work hard to keep a database of high quality real users, and our moderation team works 24/7 to spot any malicious profiles. We also have a photo verification system in place to prevent fake users from using the app. However, if you're suspicious about a profile, please report them and we'll check them immediately.", 'modified': '2020-05-25T08:44:37Z'}
review:
I live in a city with a 2.3 million population. It is a 6.6 million population for our metro area. Yet, for some reason a vast majority of profiles claim to be located in a small, blue collar, refinery town 40 miles South of the city with a population of 45,000. These refinery town profiles feature pictures of fashion model types dining at upscale eateries and traveling the globe.

Other profiles claiming to be local are clearly from third world countries around the globe sometimes depicting women in squalid living conditions. 

If you are ever contacted by someone on the app, it is always a scam to get you to send money, or attach your bank account to a bitcoin trading system overseas. It is amazing how thinly veiled these scams are yet some people fall for them.

This app is packed with phony profiles, scams and offers many ways to separate you from your cash.

Apple should ban this fraud from the App Store. This is blatant theft.
title: Badoo is a complete scam. Save your money.

developerResponse: {'id': 4255970, 'body': 'Hey! Sorry to hear about this. Are the photos you’re uploading following our guidelines? You can find more information here https://badoo.com/help/?section=5. If they are, please contact us at badoo.com/feedback, and we’ll take a look for you.', 'modified': '2018-09-18T18:22:45Z'}
review: I’ve enjoyed this out except for there are times that it wants you to verify yourself over & over again. Very very frustrating. The other thing that I don’t like is some of my pictures are not accepted and it’s telling me that there either not appropriate or not my photos and none of the reasons why they’re not accepted are true.   I don’t know if this is a glitch but I wish they would fix it other than that it’s a great app.
title: Okay. Could be better.

review: They constantly block you from talking to people on here, women don’t get the same restrictions that men do. They want you to constantly spend money to talk to people. And you only can message unpopular women, so basically you’re stuck with a small selection of hand-picked women that they want you to talk to.

The ppl on here are amazing too you can find love to dating to just friends so it will definitely have what your looking for plus it is user friendly and anyone can do it this app has changed my lonely Saturday nights and I’m absolutely  thankful for this app

review: About 90% of the profiles that say they are local to me are in fact thousands of miles away.  In other words the profile states the user is in my city but they are actually in another country hours away by plane.  It’s ridiculous.  Of course I used the location filter but that doesn’t work when so many users misrepresent their location and the app doesn’t control for it.
title: Profiles say local but user is thousands of miles away

review:
To start, this app it obviously a cheap knockoff of tinder. 90% of matches are over 50 miles away or more, and there is no way to filter by distance. I’ve even gotten multiple matches from out of country (Indonesia, Thailand) and have not been out of the country since downloading the app. 

In my opinion, there’s no point in swiping or trying to find someone if the people showing up are located 50-70 miles away, that’s at least a 2-3 hour drive. Until there is a distance filter, this app will continue to be unusable and mediocre at its best.
title: Terrible distance filter, pointless app

review: On December 6, 2015 I met my husband on Badoo (his was called Blendr, so I guess it is by the same creators) I really wish we could retrieve all our messages between each other so we could print them out and make a book. We both tried every way we could to retrieve hem but they go away after you disable your account. 😒

Potential is there so give it a shot but I believe other apps do the job better.

One of the reasons I liked the app so much is because it had a lot of great features, like seeing who liked me, for free that a lot of other apps don't offer. After the update I don't plan on using the app anymore, but before it honestly was a really great app and it would have been great if it would have stayed the same.

review: Only thing positive, no fake ads. Ran out of local profiles in under 24 hours, cannot see likes, almost no interaction with anyone in first day (1 like) and based on what I saw, would not want to chat. Most ads are not good. There is another upside in that if you make a connection, free messaging, however I do not see one happening. They tried for a no nonsense dating app here, problem is it did not quite get there. Shallow member base, communication is non existent, definitely not worth paying any money to get added features.

developerResponse: {'id': 12258210, 'body': 'You can message anyone you match with for free! Badoo is free to use. If you don’t have a match with a user you will need to use credits to start a chat. review:
I searched for a “free” dating app on the AppStore and this one is popular. While registering is free the most important part of the process costs money.

That part, is talking! To talk to people you have to buy coins, and each time you start a chat you have to spend like 200 coins or some nonsense like that. I don’t want to spend money just to talk to some girls who will most likely just ignore me.

Free dating does not describe this app, so if you do not feel like spending money to talk to people, don’t use this.

review: Badoo has a history of using cheap tactics to trick users into buying overpriced subscriptions or packages. Do a google search for “badoo scam” and you’ll see some examples. I tried to exit one of their ads that popped up, pressed the wrong button, and tried to exit again but my Touch ID activated an $80 payment for one of their plans. I contacted them immediately but they would not let refund me. Plenty of others have made this same mistake and I have no doubt that it’s intentionally set up this way. Don’t download this app and don’t trust this company.
title: Scammers

title: Some things are difficult

review:
I have no issues with Badoo functionality or features. My problem is with the Ads that the app contains. 

Some, (not all) of the embedded ads are causing my router to pickup phishing and malware attempts. It took me a while to realize this app was the culprit, but I confirmed the pattern on Dec 18, 2019. Sadly, I had to delete my Badoo account because of this. 

The app publisher may not be aware of this issue, but they should be more careful who they sell ad space to and develop a way to insure the embedded ads are clean.
title: Beware - The Ads Are Problematic

review:
Usually I split my dating apps by features, people, and community, but this one has it all! 

The girls on live look real. On other apps, the girls look like they got botched surgery via the filter, or they exaggerate their eyes to look like Disney cartoons. 

There's a chat function that connects you with real people! Haven't met a single bot. These aren't necessarily dating matches either, so there's no pressure! :) 

You can record short video clips as responses on your profile. Also, video calling is in-app. 

Everything I want in a dating app is here. ☆
title: Great features, real people

review:

99+ likes per day, all from less than desirable people. One person messaged me asking what someone like myself was doing in “this half-rate gin joint” and I had to agree.  

I can NOT even remotely recommend this dating service.

review: Deceitful and fraudulent practices. review:
It’s organized in a very messy way—putting your likes, views, matches and messages all in one tab. The filtering options are quite limited and anyone who comes across your profile has the freedom to send you a message regardless of if you have actually matched with them. 
If you are looking for something casual, then Badoo works. If you are looking for something remotely romantic or substantive you’ll be looking for a lonnnnng time with Badoo.

review:
When Badoo started sending me a bunch of notifications that “so-and-so want to chat” without them actually having sent them a message that’s when I turned off badoo notifications.

It used to be ok, but “meh” is the best it gets from me since they started that nonsense

The developer’s response was to ignore the alerts. I’m really not interested in the app notifying me several times per day that I have a message when it’s really just the site saying “so-and-so wants to chat” without them having actually messaged me.
There should be a setting to turn this off in the app.

Deleted the app, that fixed it
